comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Lt Montague Vincent Altman according to his MIC. Date of entry into war Sept 1917 France. Address given as 44 Pattison Road, London. Died 27 Jan 1944 at Hampstead General Hospital. Probate granted to Kathleen Marion Bessie Altman, widow. Effects valued at £9757. Death record shows that he was born in 1879. Married KMB Cundell or Billett in Barnet in 1930. Marion Kathleen Bessie Billett was born in 1884. In 1910 she had married Augustus Cundell Greiffenhagen in Hampstead. Electoral registers for London show him living in Hendon 1918-1931; then in Hornsey. An online family tree reveals that he was born 29 July 1878 in Holloway, son of Albert Joseph Altman and Margaret Eliza Vernon. In 1910 he was living at Round Mountain, Nye, Nevada where he was described as 'Merchant, Drugstore'. Round Mountain is best known for the Round Mountain Gold Mine, a large open pit heap-leach gold mine clearly visible on Google Earth. The first gold production was in 1906. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Round_Mountain,_Nevada

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: London Gazette shows: The undermentioned Cadets to be temp. 2nd Lts. 28th Oct.'1917:— Montague Vincent Altman www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30390/supplements/11983/p... There is a water-damaged WWI service record page for a Montague Altman. Stamped Lincoln's Inn and London Whitehall Jun 1917. Birthplace: London Examined: May 1917 Declared age: 3[?] 296 days Height: 6 feet 0 1/2 inches Stationed at: Berkhamsted, arrival 11.6.1917. Disembarkation 1.9.1917.
